review: Let me start by saying I am a Roku guy.  I have 2 of them and they are awesome.  So why did I buy an apple tv?1.  The simple answer is the mirror feature.  With apple tv I can stream the CBS app on my iphone and have it play through my TV.  Why do you need this?  Well we dumped our cable and CBS shows are only available online or apps.  This is a super easy way to keep current on all our shows.  You can do this with anything else on your iphone or ipad.  I use the iphone because the stream window is almost full TV size where the ipad is minimized.2.  I was blown away by the HD quality.  It puts roku to shame.  My wife, who can't tell the difference between standard def and HD on  Uverse even noticed the difference between the roku and the apple tv.Why didn't you give this a 5 star rating?  2 reasons:1.  You can't watch your amazon prime, though as I write this I haven't tried mirroring from my phone.  C'mon apple, add the app.2.  You can't add any channels. You get what apple gives you.  This is where Roku shines.  My recommendation get both.

review: The Apple TV is probably Apple's best accessory.Aside from being a standalone streaming device, the Apple TV supports AirPlay, which blows the doors off any any other competition. AirPlay allows for any iOS device running iOS 4 or later to play any video or audio over Wi-Fi. AirPlay mirroring is supported on the iPad 2 and later the iPhone 4S and later, or Mac 2011 and later, which allows for whatever is on your device screen to be mirrored to your HD screen without a VGA cable. This is great for Demos, gaming, and Presentations.Another underrated future, is iTunes Home Sharing, which is supported across every iOS device and Mac computer already. That allows for everything in your iTunes library to be streamed to the TV, including encoded DVDs or Blu-rays. I legally encode the physical media that I own and store it on a hard drive. It's all easily accessible through iTunes and the Apple TV.
